root.name: del

example.code:
a = [1,2,3] print(a) # Prints: [1,2,3] del a[0] # Delete the list member at index 0. print(a) # Prints: [2, 3] del a # Delete the variable 'a'
b = {'a': 1, 'b': 2, 'c': 3} print('a' in b) # Prints 'True'
del b['a'] print('a' in b) # Prints 'False'

root.description: Remove an item from a list given its index, or a key/value pair from a dictionary. The del keyword can also delete an entire variable.

parameter.label: a
parameter.description: list or dictionary to delete from, or variable to delete

parameter.label: i
parameter.description: index of list member or key of key/value pair to delete
